verses.verse: ( The Parable of the Banquet) ( ( 490 14:15-24 )) Καὶ <WG2532> Kai [Once] ἀποκριθεὶς <WG611> apokritheis spoke ὁ <WG3588> ho - Ἰησοῦς <WG2424> Iēsous Jesus πάλιν <WG3825> palin again , εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen . . . ἐν <WG1722> en in παραβολαῖς <WG3850> parabolais parables αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois to them λέγων <WG3004> legōn - :

Ὡμοιώθη <WG3666> Hōmoiōthē is like ἡ <WG3588> hē “ The βασιλεία <WG932> basileia kingdom τῶν <WG3588> tōn of οὐρανῶν <WG3772> ouranōn heaven ἀνθρώπῳ <WG444> anthrōpō vvv βασιλεῖ <WG935> basilei a king ὅστις <WG3748> hostis who ἐποίησεν <WG4160> epoiēsen prepared γάμους <WG1062> gamous a wedding banquet τῷ <WG3588> tō for υἱῷ <WG5207> huiō son . αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his

καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἀπέστειλεν <WG649> apesteilen He sent τοὺς <WG3588> tous - δούλους <WG1401> doulous servants αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his καλέσαι <WG2564> kalesai to call τοὺς <WG3588> tous those κεκλημένους <WG2564> keklēmenous he had invited εἰς <WG1519> eis to τοὺς <WG3588> tous the γάμους <WG1062> gamous banquet , καὶ <WG2532> kai but οὐκ <WG3756> ouk . . . ἤθελον <WG2309> ēthelon they refused ἐλθεῖν <WG2064> elthein to come .

Πάλιν <WG3825> Palin Again , ἀπέστειλεν <WG649> apesteilen he sent ἄλλους <WG243> allous other δούλους <WG1401> doulous servants λέγων <WG3004> legōn [and] said , Εἴπατε <WG2036> Eipate ‘ Tell τοῖς <WG3588> tois those who κεκλημένοις <WG2564> keklēmenois have been invited Ἰδοὺ <WG2400> Idou that τὸ <WG3588> to - ἄριστόν <WG712> ariston dinner . μου <WG1473> mou my ἡτοίμακα <WG2090> hētoimaka I have prepared οἱ <WG3588> hoi - ταῦροί <WG5022> tauroi oxen μου <WG1473> mou My καὶ <WG2532> kai and τὰ <WG3588> ta - σιτιστὰ <WG4619> sitista fattened cattle τεθυμένα <WG2380> tethymena have been killed , καὶ <WG2532> kai and πάντα <WG3956> panta everything [is] ἕτοιμα <WG2092> hetoima ready . δεῦτε <WG1205> deute Come εἰς <WG1519> eis to τοὺς <WG3588> tous the γάμους <WG1062> gamous wedding banquet . ’

Οἱ <WG3588> Hoi - δὲ <WG1161> de But ἀμελήσαντες <WG272> amelēsantes they paid no attention ἀπῆλθον <WG565> apēlthon [and] went away , ὃς <WG3739> hos one μὲν <WG3303> men - εἰς <WG1519> eis to τὸν <WG3588> ton - ἴδιον <WG2398> idion his ἀγρόν <WG68> agron field , ὃς <WG3739> hos another δὲ <WG1161> de - ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi to τὴν <WG3588> tēn - ἐμπορίαν <WG1711> emporian business . αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his

οἱ <WG3588> hoi The δὲ <WG1161> de - λοιποὶ <WG3062> loipoi rest κρατήσαντες <WG2902> kratēsantes seized τοὺς <WG3588> tous - δούλους <WG1401> doulous servants , αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his ὕβρισαν <WG5195> hybrisan mistreated [them] , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀπέκτειναν <WG615> apekteinan killed [them] .

Ὁ <WG3588> Ho The δὲ <WG1161> de - βασιλεὺς <WG935> basileus king ὠργίσθη <WG3710> ōrgisthē was enraged , καὶ <WG2532> kai and πέμψας <WG3992> pempsas he sent τὰ <WG3588> ta - στρατεύματα <WG4753> strateumata troops αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his ἀπώλεσεν <WG622> apōlesen to destroy τοὺς <WG3588> tous - φονεῖς <WG5406> phoneis murderers ἐκείνους <WG1565> ekeinous those καὶ <WG2532> kai and τὴν <WG3588> tēn - πόλιν <WG4172> polin city . αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn their ἐνέπρησεν <WG1714> eneprēsen burn

τότε <WG5119> tote Then λέγει <WG3004> legei he said τοῖς <WG3588> tois to δούλοις <WG1401> doulois servants , αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his Ὁ <WG3588> Ho The μὲν <WG3303> men ‘ - γάμος <WG1062> gamos wedding banquet ἕτοιμός <WG2092> hetoimos ready , ἐστιν <WG1510> estin is οἱ <WG3588> hoi those δὲ <WG1161> de but κεκλημένοι <WG2564> keklēmenoi I invited οὐκ <WG3756> ouk not ἦσαν <WG1510> ēsan were ἄξιοι <WG514> axioi worthy .

πορεύεσθε <WG4198> poreuesthe Go οὖν <WG3767> oun therefore ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi to τὰς <WG3588> tas the διεξόδους <WG1327> diexodous crossroads τῶν <WG3588> tōn . . . ὁδῶν <WG3598> hodōn . . . καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὅσους <WG3745> hosous as many as ἐὰν <WG1437> ean . . . εὕρητε <WG2147> heurēte you can find . ’ καλέσατε <WG2564> kalesate invite εἰς <WG1519> eis to τοὺς <WG3588> tous the γάμους <WG1062> gamous banquet

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai So ἐξελθόντες <WG1831> exelthontes went out οἱ <WG3588> hoi the δοῦλοι <WG1401> douloi servants ἐκεῖνοι <WG1565> ekeinoi - εἰς <WG1519> eis into τὰς <WG3588> tas the ὁδοὺς <WG3598> hodous streets συνήγαγον <WG4863> synēgagon [and] gathered πάντας <WG3956> pantas everyone οὓς <WG3739> hous . . . εὗρον <WG2147> heuron they could find , πονηρούς <WG4190> ponērous evil τε <WG5037> te both καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀγαθούς <WG18> agathous good , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐπλήσθη <WG4130> eplēsthē was filled ὁ <WG3588> ho the γάμος* <WG1062> gamos wedding hall ἀνακειμένων <WG345> anakeimenōn with guests .

Εἰσελθὼν <WG1525> Eiselthōn came in δὲ <WG1161> de But when ὁ <WG3588> ho the βασιλεὺς <WG935> basileus king θεάσασθαι <WG2300> theasasthai to see τοὺς <WG3588> tous the ἀνακειμένους <WG345> anakeimenous guests , εἶδεν <WG3708> eiden he spotted ἐκεῖ <WG1563> ekei - ἄνθρωπον <WG444> anthrōpon a man οὐκ <WG3756> ouk [who was] not ἐνδεδυμένον <WG1746> endedymenon dressed ἔνδυμα <WG1742> endyma clothes . γάμου <WG1062> gamou in wedding

καὶ <WG2532> kai - λέγει <WG3004> legei he asked αὐτῷ <WG846> autō - , Ἑταῖρε <WG2083> Hetaire ‘ Friend , ’ πῶς <WG4459> pōs ‘ how εἰσῆλθες <WG1525> eisēlthes did you get in ὧδε <WG5602> hōde here μὴ <WG3361> mē vvv ἔχων <WG2192> echōn without ἔνδυμα <WG1742> endyma clothes ? ’ γάμου <WG1062> gamou wedding Ὁ <WG3588> Ho - δὲ <WG1161> de But ἐφιμώθη <WG5392> ephimōthē [the man] was speechless .

Τότε <WG5119> Tote Then ὁ <WG3588> ho the βασιλεὺς <WG935> basileus king εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen told τοῖς <WG3588> tois the διακόνοις <WG1249> diakonois servants , Δήσαντες <WG1210> Dēsantes ‘ Tie αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou him πόδας <WG4228> podas foot , καὶ <WG2532> kai and χεῖρας <WG5495> cheiras hand ἐκβάλετε <WG1544> ekbalete [and] throw him αὐτὸν <WG846> auton . . . εἰς <WG1519> eis into τὸ <WG3588> to the σκότος <WG4655> skotos darkness , τὸ <WG3588> to - ἐξώτερον <WG1857> exōteron outer ἐκεῖ <WG1563> ekei [where] there ἔσται <WG1510> estai will be ὁ <WG3588> ho - κλαυθμὸς <WG2805> klauthmos weeping καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὁ <WG3588> ho - βρυγμὸς <WG1030> brygmos gnashing τῶν <WG3588> tōn of ὀδόντων <WG3599> odontōn teeth . ’
Πολλοὶ <WG4183> Polloi many γάρ <WG1063> gar For εἰσιν <WG1510> eisin are κλητοὶ <WG2822> klētoi called , ὀλίγοι <WG3641> oligoi few [are] δὲ <WG1161> de but ἐκλεκτοί <WG1588> eklektoi chosen . ”

( Paying Taxes to Caesar) ( ( 480 12:13-17 ; 490 20:19-26 )) Τότε <WG5119> Tote Then πορευθέντες <WG4198> poreuthentes went out οἱ <WG3588> hoi the Φαρισαῖοι <WG5330> Pharisaioi Pharisees συμβούλιον <WG4824> symboulion . . . ἔλαβον <WG2983> elabon [and] conspired ὅπως <WG3704> hopōs . . . αὐτὸν <WG846> auton [Jesus] παγιδεύσωσιν <WG3802> pagideusōsin to trap ἐν <WG1722> en in λόγῳ <WG3056> logō His words .

καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἀποστέλλουσιν <WG649> apostellousin They sent αὐτῷ <WG846> autō to Him τοὺς <WG3588> tous - μαθητὰς <WG3101> mathētas disciples αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn their μετὰ <WG3326> meta along with τῶν <WG3588> tōn the Ἡρῳδιανῶν <WG2265> Hērōdianōn Herodians . λέγοντες* <WG3004> legontes they said , Διδάσκαλε <WG1320> Didaskale “ Teacher , ” οἴδαμεν <WG1492> oidamen “ we know ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that ἀληθὴς <WG227> alēthēs honest εἶ <WG1510> ei You are καὶ <WG2532> kai and [that] τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ὁδὸν <WG3598> hodon way τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou of God ἐν <WG1722> en in accordance with ἀληθείᾳ <WG225> alētheia the truth . διδάσκεις <WG1321> didaskeis You teach καὶ <WG2532> kai - οὐ <WG3756> ou vvv μέλει <WG3199> melei seek favor σοι <WG4771> soi You περὶ <WG4012> peri from οὐδενός <WG3762> oudenos no one , οὐ <WG3756> ou vvv γὰρ <WG1063> gar because βλέπεις <WG991> blepeis You pay no attention εἰς <WG1519> eis to πρόσωπον <WG4383> prosōpon external appearance ἀνθρώπων <WG444> anthrōpōn . . . .

εἰπὸν <WG2036> eipon tell οὖν <WG3767> oun So ἡμῖν <WG1473> hēmin us τί <WG5101> ti what σοι <WG4771> soi You δοκεῖ <WG1380> dokei think : ἔξεστιν <WG1832> exestin Is it lawful δοῦναι <WG1325> dounai to pay κῆνσον <WG2778> kēnson taxes Καίσαρι <WG2541> Kaisari to Caesar ἢ <WG2228> ē or οὔ <WG3756> ou not ? ”

Γνοὺς <WG1097> Gnous knew δὲ <WG1161> de But ὁ <WG3588> ho - Ἰησοῦς <WG2424> Iēsous Jesus τὴν <WG3588> tēn - πονηρίαν <WG4189> ponērian evil intent αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn their εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen [and] said , Τί <WG5101> Ti why με <WG1473> me Me ? πειράζετε <WG3985> peirazete are you testing ὑποκριταί <WG5273> hypokritai “ You hypocrites ,

ἐπιδείξατέ <WG1925> epideixate Show μοι <WG1473> moi Me τὸ <WG3588> to the νόμισμα <WG3546> nomisma coin τοῦ <WG3588> tou used for κήνσου <WG2778> kēnsou the tax . ” Οἱ <WG3588> Hoi - δὲ <WG1161> de And προσήνεγκαν <WG4374> prosēnenkan they brought αὐτῷ <WG846> autō Him δηνάριον <WG1220> dēnarion a denarius . ( A denarius was customarily a day’s wage for a laborer; see .)

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai - λέγει <WG3004> legei He asked αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois . . . , Τίνος <WG5101> Tinos “ Whose ἡ <WG3588> hē - εἰκὼν <WG1504> eikōn image αὕτη <WG3778> hautē [is] this , ” καὶ <WG2532> kai “ and ἡ <WG3588> hē whose ἐπιγραφή <WG1923> epigraphē inscription ? ”

Λέγουσιν <WG3004> Legousin they answered ‹αὐτῷ› <WG846> autō . . . . Καίσαρος <WG2541> Kaisaros “ Caesar’s , ” Τότε <WG5119> Tote - λέγει <WG3004> legei [Jesus] told αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois them , Ἀπόδοτε <WG591> Apodote “ Give οὖν <WG3767> oun So τὰ <WG3588> ta what [is] Καίσαρος <WG2541> Kaisaros Caesar’s , Καίσαρι <WG2541> Kaisari to Caesar καὶ <WG2532> kai and τὰ <WG3588> ta what [is] τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou God’s . ” τῷ <WG3588> tō - Θεῷ <WG2316> Theō to God

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai And ἀκούσαντες <WG191> akousantes when they heard [this] , ἐθαύμασαν <WG2296> ethaumasan they were amazed . καὶ <WG2532> kai So ἀφέντες <WG863> aphentes they left αὐτὸν <WG846> auton Him ἀπῆλθαν <WG565> apēlthan [and] went away .

( The Sadducees and the Resurrection) ( ( 480 12:18-27 ; 490 20:27-40 )) Ἐν <WG1722> En - ἐκείνῃ <WG1565> ekeinē That τῇ <WG3588> tē [same] ἡμέρᾳ <WG2250> hēmera day προσῆλθον <WG4334> prosēlthon came αὐτῷ <WG846> autō to [Jesus] Σαδδουκαῖοι <WG4523> Saddoukaioi [the] Sadducees , λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes who say μὴ <WG3361> mē no εἶναι <WG1510> einai there is ἀνάστασιν <WG386> anastasin resurrection , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἐπηρώτησαν <WG1905> epērōtēsan questioned αὐτὸν <WG846> auton Him .

λέγοντες <WG3004> legontes they said , Διδάσκαλε <WG1320> Didaskale “ Teacher , ” Μωϋσῆς <WG3475> Mōusēs “ Moses εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen declared that Ἐάν <WG1437> Ean if τις <WG5100> tis a man ἀποθάνῃ <WG599> apothanē dies μὴ <WG3361> mē without ἔχων <WG2192> echōn having τέκνα <WG5043> tekna children , ἐπιγαμβρεύσει <WG1918> epigambreusei is to marry ὁ <WG3588> ho - ἀδελφὸς <WG80> adelphos brother αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his τὴν <WG3588> tēn the γυναῖκα <WG1135> gynaika widow αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou - καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀναστήσει <WG450> anastēsei raise up σπέρμα <WG4690> sperma offspring τῷ <WG3588> tō for ἀδελφῷ <WG80> adelphō [him] . ( ) αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou -

ἦσαν <WG1510> ēsan there were δὲ <WG1161> de Now παρ’ <WG3844> par’ among ἡμῖν <WG1473> hēmin us . ἑπτὰ <WG2033> hepta seven ἀδελφοί <WG80> adelphoi brothers καὶ <WG2532> kai - ὁ <WG3588> ho The πρῶτος <WG4413> prōtos first [one] γήμας <WG1060> gēmas married ἐτελεύτησεν <WG5053> eteleutēsen died καὶ <WG2532> kai and μὴ <WG3361> mē without ἔχων <WG2192> echōn having σπέρμα <WG4690> sperma children . ἀφῆκεν <WG863> aphēken [So] he left τὴν <WG3588> tēn - γυναῖκα <WG1135> gynaika wife αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his τῷ <WG3588> tō to ἀδελφῷ <WG80> adelphō brother . αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou his

ὁμοίως <WG3668> homoiōs The same thing happened to καὶ <WG2532> kai . . . ὁ <WG3588> ho the δεύτερος <WG1208> deuteros second καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὁ <WG3588> ho - τρίτος <WG5154> tritos third [brothers] , ἕως <WG2193> heōs down to τῶν <WG3588> tōn the ἑπτά <WG2033> hepta seventh .
ὕστερον <WG5305> hysteron last δὲ <WG1161> de And πάντων <WG3956> pantōn of all , ἀπέθανεν <WG599> apethanen died . ἡ <WG3588> hē the γυνή <WG1135> gynē woman

ἐν <WG1722> en In τῇ <WG3588> tē the ἀναστάσει <WG386> anastasei resurrection , οὖν <WG3767> oun then , τίνος <WG5101> tinos whose τῶν <WG3588> tōn of the ἑπτὰ <WG2033> hepta seven ? ἔσται <WG1510> estai will she be γυνή <WG1135> gynē wife πάντες <WG3956> pantes all of them γὰρ <WG1063> gar For ἔσχον <WG2192> eschon were married αὐτήν <WG846> autēn to her . ”

Ἀποκριθεὶς <WG611> Apokritheis answered δὲ <WG1161> de - ὁ <WG3588> ho - Ἰησοῦς <WG2424> Iēsous Jesus εἶπεν <WG2036> eipen - αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois - , Πλανᾶσθε <WG4105> Planasthe “ You are mistaken [because] μὴ <WG3361> mē vvv εἰδότες <WG1492> eidotes you do not know τὰς <WG3588> tas the γραφὰς <WG1124> graphas Scriptures μηδὲ <WG3366> mēde or τὴν <WG3588> tēn the δύναμιν <WG1411> dynamin power τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou of God .

ἐν <WG1722> en In γὰρ <WG1063> gar - τῇ <WG3588> tē the ἀναστάσει <WG386> anastasei resurrection , οὔτε <WG3777> oute vvv γαμοῦσιν <WG1060> gamousin [people] will neither marry οὔτε <WG3777> oute nor γαμίζονται <WG1061> gamizontai be given in marriage . ἀλλ’ <WG235> all’ Instead , ὡς <WG5613> hōs like ἄγγελοι <WG32> angeloi [the] angels ( SBL, BYZ, and TR the angels of God) ἐν <WG1722> en in τῷ <WG3588> tō - οὐρανῷ <WG3772> ouranō heaven . εἰσιν <WG1510> eisin they will be

περὶ <WG4012> peri concerning δὲ <WG1161> de But τῆς <WG3588> tēs the ἀναστάσεως <WG386> anastaseōs resurrection τῶν <WG3588> tōn of the νεκρῶν <WG3498> nekrōn dead , οὐκ <WG3756> ouk vvv ἀνέγνωτε <WG314> anegnōte have you not read τὸ <WG3588> to what ῥηθὲν <WG2046> rhēthen said ὑμῖν <WG4771> hymin to you ὑπὸ <WG5259> hypo - τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou God λέγοντος <WG3004> legontos - :

Ἐγώ <WG1473> Egō ‘ I εἰμι <WG1510> eimi am ὁ <WG3588> ho the Θεὸς <WG2316> Theos God Ἀβραὰμ <WG11> Abraam of Abraham , καὶ <WG2532> kai - ὁ <WG3588> ho the Θεὸς <WG2316> Theos God Ἰσαὰκ <WG2464> Isaak of Isaac , καὶ <WG2532> kai and ὁ <WG3588> ho the Θεὸς <WG2316> Theos God Ἰακώβ <WG2384> Iakōb of Jacob ’ ? ( ) οὐκ <WG3756> ouk not ἔστιν <WG1510> estin He is ὁ <WG3588> ho the Θεὸς <WG2316> Theos God νεκρῶν <WG3498> nekrōn of [the] dead , ἀλλὰ <WG235> alla but ζώντων <WG2198> zōntōn of [the] living . ”

Καὶ <WG2532> Kai When ἀκούσαντες <WG191> akousantes heard [this] , οἱ <WG3588> hoi the ὄχλοι <WG3793> ochloi crowds ἐξεπλήσσοντο <WG1605> exeplēssonto they were astonished ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi at τῇ <WG3588> tē - διδαχῇ <WG1322> didachē teaching . αὐτοῦ <WG846> autou His

Οἱ <WG3588> Hoi the ( The Greatest Commandment) δὲ <WG1161> de And [when] Φαρισαῖοι <WG5330> Pharisaioi Pharisees ἀκούσαντες <WG191> akousantes heard ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that ἐφίμωσεν <WG5392> ephimōsen [Jesus] had silenced τοὺς <WG3588> tous the Σαδδουκαίους <WG4523> Saddoukaious Sadducees , συνήχθησαν <WG4863> synēchthēsan they themselves gathered ἐπὶ <WG1909> epi together . τὸ <WG3588> to . . . αὐτό <WG846> auto . . .
